title: Jays find offense, hit 5 HRs in Game 3 rout of M's
content: The Blue Jays, after losing the first two games of the ALCS at home, tattooed baseballs all over T-Mobile Park on Wednesday, smashing five home runs and four doubles in a 13-4 rout of the Mariners to avoid facing an elimination game Thursday.

content: Kings forward Keegan Murray has agreed to a five-year, $140 million rookie contract extension with the franchise, his representatives told ESPN.

title: Knicks' Brogdon retiring after nine NBA seasons
content: Knicks guard Malcolm Brogdon, a former NBA Rookie of the Year and Sixth Man of the Year, has decided to retire after nine NBA seasons, he told ESPN.

content: George Pickens, who is set to become an unrestricted free agent after the season, praised the Cowboys but noted he also wants to "showcase my talents."

content: US President Donald Trump has claimed Prime Minister Narendra Modi has assured Washington that New Delhi will stop buying oil from Russia soon, in what he believes would bring peace to war-torn Ukraine.

title: Donald Trump Claims India Will Stop Buying Russian Oil. What Numbers Say
content: US President Donald Trump has claimed that India has assured him that it will curb its Russian seaborne crude exports, months after Washington slapped 25 per cent punitive tariffs on New Delhi over the purchase.

title: White House Likely To Lay Off 10,000 Workers During Shutdown
content: The White House said Wednesday it will likely lay off at least 10,000 federal workers during the US government shutdown as Republican President Donald Trump steps up pressure on Democrats.

title: Defence Ministry Signs Rs 659 Crore Deal For Night Sights For SIG 716 Rifles
content: The Ministry of Defence on Wednesday signed a contract worth Rs 659.47 crore for the procurement of Night Sights (image intensifiers) for the 7.62x51 mm SIG 716 assault rifle, along with associated accessories for the Indian Army

title: Trump To Visit Japan This Month Amid Trade Tensions With Asia
content: US President Donald Trump will travel to Japan later this month before he attends the annual Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in South Korea, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Wednesday.

title: 25 Transgenders Consume 'Phenyl' In Madhya Pradesh, Hospitalised
content: Around 25 people from the transgender community in Indore claimed to have consumed phenyl together on Wednesday night after which they were admitted to a government hospital, an official said.

title: Two-State Solution Remains 'Ultimate Objective' For Middle East Peace: India
content: Minister of State for External Affairs and Environment, Forest and Climate Change Kirti Vardhan Singh reaffirmed India's long-standing commitment to the Palestinian cause and the pursuit of peace in the Middle East

title: Arrested Indian-Origin Expert Ashley Tellis Denies Charges Over Secret Files
content: A prominent US scholar of India who was arrested after allegations of retaining classified documents and meeting Chinese officials is denying the charges against him, his lawyers said Wednesday.

title: Farmer's Son Tops Rajasthan Administrative Service 2023, Top 3 From Ajmer
content: The Rajasthan Public Service Commission (RPSC) has announced the final results of the Rajasthan State and Subordinate Services Combined Competitive Examination (RAS) 2023.

title: Trump Claims PM Modi Has Assured Him "India Will Not Buy Oil From Russia"
content: US President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that Prime Minister Narendra Modi told him that India will stop buying oil from Russia, a move Trump described as a "big step" in efforts to isolate Moscow economically.

title: YouTube Down For Thousands Of Users In US: Report
content: Alphabet-owned YouTube was down for over 320,000 users in the United States on Wednesday evening, according to Downdetector.

title: "Great Man": Trump Praises PM Modi's Meeting With US Envoy Sergio Gor
content: Lauding Prime Minister Narendra Modi as a "great man," US President Donald Trump praised the outcome of the recent meeting between US Ambassador-designate Sergio Gor and the Indian leader.

title: Venezuela President Nicolas Maduro Decries "Coups Orchestrated By CIA"
content: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro on Wednesday decried what he called "coups d'etat orchestrated by the CIA" shortly after US counterpart Donald Trump said he was considering strikes against Venezuelan cartels on land.

title: US Tariffs Not A Matter Of Huge Concern For India's Growth: RBI Governor
content: India has recorded phenomenal growth with over 8 per cent projections in the past year amid unprecedented global uncertainties, RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said at the International Monetary Fund's (IMF) annual meeting on Wednesday.

title: UK PM Keir Starmer Publishes Evidence In Collapsed China Spy Case
content: The UK government published evidence Wednesday it had submitted in now-collapsed legal proceedings against two men accused of spying for China, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer seeks to contain controversy over the failed case.

title: Israel Threatens To Resume Fighting If Hamas Does Not Respect Gaza Deal
content: Israel's defence minister on Wednesday threatened to resume fighting if Hamas does not honour the terms of a US-backed ceasefire that halted the war in Gaza.

title: Trump Confirms He Authorised Covert CIA Operations In Venezuela
content: US President Donald Trump confirmed reports on Wednesday that he authorised the CIA to conduct covert operations in Venezuela, marking a sharp escalation in U.S. efforts to pressure President Nicolas Maduro's government.

title: Planning Underway For International Force In Gaza, Says US Adviser
content: The United States is looking to establish a basic stabilization of Gaza and planning is underway for an international force to go into the Palestinian enclave, said a senior U.S. adviser, speaking on condition of anonymity, on Wednesday.

title: US Court Temporarily Halts Shutdown Layoffs Of Federal Workers
content: A federal judge ordered a temporary halt on Wednesday to the layoffs by the Trump administration of thousands of federal workers during the government shutdown, US media reported.

title: 'He is a great man': Trump says PM Modi assured him India won't buy Russian oil; hits out at Putin
content: US President Donald Trump announced that Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has assured him India will cease Russian oil purchases. Trump expressed satisfaction with this commitment, viewing it as a significant step towards de-escalating the Ukraine conflict. He highlighted his strong relationship with Modi and reiterated his desire for the war to end swiftly.

title: Dramatic twist: In ASI suicide case, FIR names IPS officer's wife
content: Rohtak police registered an FIR for abetment to suicide and criminal conspiracy against four individuals, including the wife and brother-in-law of deceased IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, following ASI Sandeep Kumar Lather's suicide. Lather accused Kumar of corruption in a final video before his death. The FIR was lodged after Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini assured justice to Lather's family.

title: Biden moment? Trump fumbles on India, Iran; reiterates tariff claim â€” Watch
content: US President Donald Trump mistakenly referred to India as Iran twice while discussing a ceasefire negotiation between Pakistan and Iran. Trump claimed he threatened both nations with 200% tariffs to prevent a nuclear war. However, India's Prime Minister Modi refuted these claims, stating no global leader urged India to halt its response to a 'big attack' from Pakistan.

title: Inside Bengaluru doctorâ€™s dark plan: Wife killed with anaesthesia overdose; death staged as natural
content: A Bengaluru doctor, Mahendra Reddy, has been arrested for allegedly murdering his wife, Dr. Kritika Reddy, six months ago. Her death was initially attributed to natural causes, but forensic reports revealed toxic substances. Mahendra reportedly confessed to poisoning her, citing marital discord over undisclosed health issues. Investigations are ongoing.

title: China crackdown: China may ban Teslaâ€™s hallmark design; targets key feature
content: China's Ministry of Industry and Information Technology is proposing a new standard that would ban hidden door handles on passenger cars, citing safety concerns. The regulation mandates exterior handles with specific dimensions and mechanical release functions, aiming to improve emergency access during accidents. Automakers will need to redesign models, with transition periods provided for compliance.

title: IND vs AUS: Shocking! Shastri breaks silence on Rohit and Kohliâ€™s retirement
content: Former India coach Ravi Shastri believes Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have "enough cricket in them" for future ODIs, including the 2027 World Cup, but emphasizes individual hunger and fitness. He suggests players will decide their own ODI futures, similar to their Test retirements, as the BCCI dismisses speculation about the Australia series being their last.

title: UK strikes at Putin's oil war chest: 90 new sanctions hit Rosneft, Lukoil, Indiaâ€™s Nayara
content: The UK has imposed 90 new sanctions on Russia's oil sector and Indian firm Nayara Energy Limited to disrupt Moscow's war funding. The measures target oil terminals, tankers, and major Russian energy companies like Rosneft and Lukoil, aiming to reduce Russian oil on the market and cut off revenue streams.

title: US shutdown: Judge blocks Trump from firing federal workers; 'can't be tolerated'
content: A federal judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration from firing federal workers during the ongoing government shutdown, citing a lack of proper consideration and a "human cost." The decision followed a legal challenge by labor unions arguing the layoff notices were an illegal attempt to pressure Congress.

title: AI confusion: Salesforce CEO admits customers still donâ€™t get it; stock down by 30%
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff acknowledged that many enterprise customers struggle with AI implementation, as innovation outpaces adoption. Despite a stock slump and investor skepticism, Salesforce is increasing AI investment, with its Agentforce platform now core to its products. While some clients have integrated AI, most face significant architectural challenges.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Deputy Vice President, Aakash K Hindocha, has identified Bikaji, Voltas, and Torrent Power as top stock recommendations. Hindocha's analysis suggests a short-term upside for Nifty towards 25450 and Bank Nifty targeting 57250.

title: IND vs AUS: 'Heâ€™s serious about 2027'- RCB teammate confirms Virat Kohliâ€™s comeback for WC
content: Dinesh Karthik revealed that Virat Kohli is actively training for the 2027 World Cup, dedicating time to practice during his recent London break. The star batsman, who has a remarkable ODI record, is reportedly serious about his ambition to participate in the next global tournament.

title: 'Getting out of hand': Ramiz Raja, Aamer Sohail bring up Asia Cup controversy
content: Pakistani teams received handshakes from opponents in hockey and cricket, a welcome sight amidst lingering tensions. Despite a dominant 93-run Test victory over South Africa, commentators used the moment to criticize India's past refusal to reciprocate sportsmanship, highlighting the ongoing impact of the Asia Cup controversy.

title: Introspection mode: Zoho founder to take a break; underlines this risk
content: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu is stepping back from external commitments to focus on coding, a move driven by his principle of practicing what he preaches. He aims to complete crucial product development, including end-to-end encryption for Zoho's Arattai messaging app, a feature designed to enhance user data privacy by storing information solely on devices.

title: Record ops: â€˜Most affectedâ€™ left-wing-hit districts down to 3 from 7
content: India is on the cusp of eradicating Naxalism by March 2026, with affected districts drastically reduced. Home Minister Amit Shah highlighted successful counter-insurgency operations and development initiatives. Andhra and Telangana are now Naxal-free, marking a significant victory in the fight against left-wing extremism.

title: Travis Kelce reveals what happened after scary head fall vs. Lions
content: Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce allayed fears of a serious head or neck injury after a hard landing during Sunday's game. He revealed on his podcast that the impact was a severe "Charlie Horse" to his thigh, not his head. Kelce continued playing, showcasing remarkable toughness and finishing the game strong, much to the relief of fans.

title: Ayesha Curry sparks outrage for flaunting luxury after controversial remarks
content: Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha Curry, is facing backlash from fans after a recent Instagram post featuring her playing golf with friends. Critics have accused her of not appreciating her husband and her life, stemming from previous comments on a podcast where she revealed she hadn't initially wanted marriage or children.

title: -Serena Williams vs Maria Sharapova net worth 2025: Who is richer?
content: Tennis titans Serena Williams and Maria Sharapova, despite different paths to success, remain influential figures. Williams, with a net worth of $350 million, continues investing and supporting women's sports. Sharapova, valued at $180 million, thrives with her candy business and real estate ventures. A touching Hall of Fame moment highlighted their enduring respect and friendship.

title: â€˜As soon as I sayâ€™: Trump says Israel could return to Gaza; vows all hostages will be freed
content: US President Donald Trump declared that Israeli forces could re-enter Gaza on his command if Hamas violates the ceasefire. He stated that Israel would swiftly address Hamas's non-compliance with hostage releases. Trump emphasized Hamas must disarm, warning of forceful action if they refuse, while also mentioning international backing for his peace plan.

title: Taylor Swiftâ€™s gift to Teyana Taylor sparks backlash over shade at Kayla Nicole
content: Taylor Swift's gift to Teyana Taylor for her new album has sparked online speculation. Fans believe the gesture is a subtle jab at Travis Kelce's ex, Kayla Nicole, who previously spoke negatively about Teyana's ex-husband, Iman Shumpert. This has reignited a past feud, with Swift's act drawing attention to celebrity entanglements.

title: Mavericks vs Lakers preseason injury report: Whoâ€™s playing and whoâ€™s out
content: Dallas Mavericks and Los Angeles Lakers clashed in a Las Vegas preseason game, with Dallas prioritizing chemistry and integrating Anthony Davis. The Lakers, however, focused on rest and player development due to injuries and load management. This strategic divergence offered a preview of each team's approach to the upcoming NBA season.

title: Bihar polls: Congress fields over 15 candidates; no Mahagathbandhan seat-sharing deal yet
content: With nominations for the Bihar Assembly elections nearing, the Congress released its first list of over 10 candidates amidst unresolved seat-sharing talks with Mahagathbandhan partners. The party faces internal discontent over alleged irregularities in ticket distribution. Meanwhile, the NDA alliance has also navigated friction over seat allocations.

title: Aryna Sabalenkaâ€™s emotional gesture for Rafael Nadalâ€™s museum wins hearts
content: Aryna Sabalenka celebrated her 2025 US Open victory by gifting her championship outfit to Rafael Nadal's museum in Mallorca. The signed Nike attire, worn during her second consecutive US Open win, is now a prized exhibit. Sabalenka's gesture highlights her deep admiration for Nadal's work ethic and enduring legacy in tennis.

title: Malcolm Brogdon retirement: NBA starâ€™s heartfelt message marks end of journey
content: Veteran point guard Malcolm Brogdon has abruptly retired from the NBA after nine seasons, informing the New York Knicks of his decision. Brogdon, a former Rookie of the Year and Sixth Man of the Year, cited a desire to end his career on his own terms. His unexpected departure leaves the Knicks with a void at the point guard position.

title: Chaos! Fan climbs enclosure, breaks into Pakistan dressing room to meet Babar Azam - WATCH
content: A young fan breached security at Gaddafi Stadium during a cricket match. The fan sought to meet star batsman Babar Azam. This occurred on Azam's birthday. Security personnel intervened and removed the fan. The Pakistan Cricket Board has not yet commented on the incident. Babar Azam remains a popular figure among fans.

title: CeeDee Lamb injury update: Cowboys star on track for Week 7 vs Commanders
content: Dallas Cowboys' star receiver CeeDee Lamb is nearing a return from a high-ankle sprain, potentially for Week 7 against the Commanders.  Lamb has shown significant progress, participating in team walkthroughs and expected to practice. His comeback would significantly bolster the Cowboys' offense, especially in the passing game and red zone, offering a crucial boost for their playoff hopes.

title: Taylor Swiftâ€™s strict friendship rule leaves Blake Lively heartbroken
content: A rift has reportedly formed between Taylor Swift and Blake Lively following a legal dispute involving Justin Baldoni. Sources suggest Swift has closed the door on their friendship, leaving Lively devastated. While Swift focuses on her new album and relationship with Travis Kelce, Lively grapples with the fallout, with neither star publicly addressing the situation.

title: What happens when you drink clove water after meal for 30 days
content: Embrace a month of clove water after meals for a natural health boost. This ancient remedy significantly enhances digestion, reduces bloating, and strengthens your immune system. It also aids in regulating blood sugar levels and promotes overall well-being. Discover the potent benefits of this simple, traditional drink for a healthier you.

title: Amla benefits: Lowers bad cholesterol and supports better heart health
content: Ancient Indian gooseberry, or Amla, is scientifically proven to boost heart health by significantly improving cholesterol levels. Rich in antioxidants, it prevents LDL oxidation and reduces inflammation, crucial for cardiovascular well-being. Consuming fresh amla or unsweetened juice offers maximum benefits, while sugary preparations should be avoided. Consult a doctor before use.

title: A failed state? Pak losing war within; how 'Quad of Terror' is taking control
content: Pakistan faces its deadliest year in a decade. Violence surges, with security personnel deaths on track to exceed 2024. Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Balochistan are major battlegrounds. The nation confronts a 'Quad of Terror' including TTP, Baloch insurgents, IS-K, and elements within the Afghan Taliban. Border clashes with Afghanistan intensify.

title: Bihar polls: BJP-JD(U) & RJD show odd unity - the reason, Prashant Kishor
content: Bihar's political rivals, BJP-JD(U) and RJD, united in mocking Jan Suraaj Party founder Prashant Kishor for opting out of the upcoming assembly elections. Leaders from all three parties dismissed his aspirations, calling his decision a premature admission of defeat and an embarrassment to his workers, suggesting his political ambitions have been thwarted.

title: Kim Zolciakâ€™s new romance after Kroy Biermann divorce sparks legal drama
content: Reality star Kim Zolciak is embroiled in drama as she faces a subpoena in her new boyfriend Kyle Mowitz's $100 million divorce. Kyle's estranged wife, Jillian Green, is demanding communications and financial proof between Kim and Kyle. Kim, who recently started dating Kyle after her own split, was reportedly served papers publicly.

title: Is Luka Doncic playing tonight vs Mavericks? Latest update on Lakers starâ€™s injury
content: Luka Doncic is expected to play tonight against the Dallas Mavericks after a stellar preseason debut, though the Lakers may limit his minutes.  LeBron James is still recovering from a sciatica injury, and Adou Thiero is out with knee swelling. Doncic, however, is healthy and ready to boost the Lakers' prospects for the upcoming season.

title: Tellis tale isn't a tell-all: Scholar charged for keeping top secret files - not spying
content: Renowned scholar Ashley Tellis faces charges for unlawfully retaining national defense information and undocumented meetings with Chinese officials. The FBI's investigation, triggered by surveillance, uncovered classified documents at his home. While the think-tank community expresses shock, many argue that meeting foreign officials is part of his role, though document handling is questioned.

title: 'Nothing is well in NDA': BJP bets big on Chirag, again; Bihar allies in a tizzy
content: NDA allies Upendra Kushwaha and Jitan Ram Manjhi are expressing discontent over seat allocations in Bihar, particularly Chirag Paswan's LJP(Ram Vilas) receiving 29 seats. Political analysts suggest this move by the BJP might be a strategy to sideline Nitish Kumar post-election.

title: Is Virat Kohli leaving RCB and retiring from IPL? 'He will play his last match ... '
content: Virat Kohli's future with Royal Challengers Bengaluru is secure. He has committed to playing for the franchise. Reports of him leaving are incorrect. Kohli has not signed a new commercial deal as he awaits potential changes in franchise ownership. He continues to be a key player for RCB and has promised to play his first and last match for Bengaluru.

title: ALCS takeaways: Best moments, Game 3 hero from Blue Jays' dominant win
content: the Toronto Blue Jays beat the Mariners 13-4 in game 3 of the American League Championship Series . a barrage of home runs led to a dominant 13-4 victory over the blue Jays . the series leads the series to 2-1 after the blues dropped the first two games at home .

title: What to know ahead of the U.S. Grand Prix at Austin
content: ESPN's Laurence Edmondson lays out the possibility of Max Verstappen making a late run for the drivers' championship . the weekend is set to be hot and sunny with temperatures above 30Â°C (86Â°F) Saturday is expected to peak at 34Â°C, giving the drivers another heat test after Singapore .

title: Rail push: 7,000 km high-speed passenger corridors across India; Vande Bharat 4.0 soon
content: the dedicated passenger corridors will be designed for a speed of 350 kmph . the minister warned suppliers and manufacturers against compromising on quality of products . he said there are three major focus areas for railways: provide enough service for passengers and their comfort .

title: Pochettino's turnaround has USMNT no longer dreading World Cup
content: Mauricio pochettino's men's national team won 2-1 against australia . the results have improved to the point that the team is unbeaten in its past three games . there is competition for places everywhere on the field .

title: Full-scale aerodrome emergency exercise conducted at Thiruvananthapuram airport
content: Thiruvananthapuram International Airport conducts a successful emergency exercise to evaluate readiness and response capabilities with precision

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: BJP firefights as allies protest seat allocation to LJP(RV)
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi asked BJP workers in Bihar to reach out to every household to spread awareness of the schemes launched by the Centre and the Nitish Kumar government

title: Centre disfavours lethal injection as mode of execution: Supreme Court
content: Senior advocate Rishi Malhotra, who has filed the petition, said at least an option should be given to a condemned prisoner as to whether he wanted hanging or lethal injection as a mode of execution

title: India pitches for supply of Akash missile system to Brazil as Rajnath Singh holds talks with Brazilian Vice-President
content: The two leaders â€œidentified priority areasâ€ for joint work, including exploring opportunities for co-development and co-production of defence equipment

title: Bengal Governor files report on Durgapur gang rape to President, Home Ministry: Official
content: In the report, Mr. Bose has given a detailed account of his findings in the case and also about his interactions with the survivor and her parents who hail from Odisha

title: PM Modi brought revolution in urban development inspired by Sardar Patelâ€™s ideals: Gujarat CM
content: Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel said that Ahmedabad â€œtruly exemplifies PM Modiâ€™s mantra of Vikas bhi Virasat bhi

title: Anbumani accuses State govt. of scuttling his padayatra
content: Dr. Anbumani claimed the government was continuously lying about the job creation and influx of investments coming into Tamil Nadu.

title: Hitachi Energyâ€™s next phase in Chennai at â‚¹2,000 crore to provide 3,000 jobs
content: Industries Minister T.R.B. Rajaa said that the Chief Minister on Wednesday met with Hitachi Energyâ€™s leadership to finalise their next phase of expansion in the State

title: Indiaâ€™s biotech surge builds momentum but faces scale bottlenecks
content: Leadership in biotechnology will require India to streamline its ecosystem and channel resources into high-impact areas. The government, industry leaders, and academia need to consolidate funding, build integrated infrastructure, and reconcile regulatory standards with international best practices

title: BJD slams Odisha CM for making his conversation with West Bengal rape survivor public
content: Despite recurrence of rape and gangrape incidents in Odisha over the last 15 months, the CM remained silent, charged Sulata Deo, BJD Rajya Sabha MP

title: Young and jobless: key demographic weighs claims and promises of parties
content: NDA government says it has been distributing lakhs of appointment letters for jobs in different sectors, with the Chief Minister promising at several events that â€˜one crore more jobs will be given in the futureâ€™; Tejashwi says lakhs of jobs were provided during the 17 months of grand alliance rule

title: CPI(M) seeks judicial probe into Dalit IPS officerâ€™s death
content: The party also called for the immediate suspension of all officials named by the late officer to prevent any interference in the investigation

title: Chaos at Patna airport as Bihar Congress leaders are heckled by party cadre
content: Congress workers from the Bikram assembly constituency confronted the leaders when they arrived at the airport alleging corruption in ticket distribution.

title: FIR registered over ASI Sandeep Latherâ€™s death; CM Nayab Saini, Opposition leader Hooda express condolences
content: His family gives consent to post-mortem; the deceased ASI had made allegations of corruption against the late IPS officer Puran and his family in a four-page note and video

title: Police deter escalation between groups over Ambedkar statue installation in Gwalior
content: More than 4,200 personnel are currently deployed in the city, including over 700 called in from neighbouring districts, along with arrangements for tear gas and other measures to prevent any escalation.Â

title: Cough syrup deaths: another child from Madhya Pradesh dies during treatment in Nagpur
content: Chhindwara Additional Collector Dhirendra Singh said the child had been admitted in Nagpur since September 14 but her condition did not improve

title: Balancing lives and conservation
content: Kerala amends wildlife laws to tackle rising human-wildlife conflicts while raising concerns over ecological impact

title: Leh court grants bail to Congress councillor, six others in September 24 violence case
content: BJP has accused councillor Stanzin Tsepag of leading violent protests that resulted in police firing . BJP hinged its allegation on a viral photo showing a masked man holding a stick . the party denies the claim, calling it "propaganda to malign the party"

title: Jaisalmer bus fire: Death toll reaches 21; 2 officials suspended
content: nine-year-old Yunus succumbed to his injuries during treatment . four other patients remain on ventilators in a critical condition at the hospital . govt suspended acting district transport officer and assistant administrative officer .

title: Police attach property of Pak-based terrorist: Md Sharif Mirasi linked to Hizbul, LeT; fled in 2010

title: Bihar polls: BJP announces third list of 18 candidates
content: In the third list, BJP has fielded Satish Kumar Yadav from Raghopur Assembly seat to take on former Deputy Chief Minister and RJD Leader Tejashwi Yadav.

title: LDF takes out rally, holds public meeting in Perambra
content: Senior CPI(M) leader accuses Cong. activists of assaulting Perambra panchayat president without any provocation

title: Karnataka Social and Educational Survey: Enumerators struggle amid long hours of work and hostile responses
content: As on Wednesday, out of a total of about 46 lakh households to be surveyed under Greater Bengaluru Authority limits, a little over 15 lakh were covered

title: Karnataka to ready 300-acre data centre park at Tavarekere in 18 months
content: According to industry experts, Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu are quite ahead of Karnataka in terms of data centre infrastructure

title: BJP firefights as allies protest seat allocation to LJP(RV)
content: Two NDA allies, Upendra Kushwahaâ€™s Rashtriya Lok Morcha (RLM) and Jitan Ram Manjhiâ€™s Hindustan Awam Morcha, have publicly expressed their displeasure. JD(U) has also conveyed their objections while refraining from making any public remarks.

title: Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Saini assures justice and support to family of deceased ASI
content: His family says it would allow the post-mortem only after a case is registered, demands probe into four-page note and video left by him

title: Supreme Court issues notice on plea seeking access to lawyer during inquiry
content: The petition says that though the right to consult a lawyer during an inquiry is statutorily recognised, it is not uniformly enforced by investigating agencies

title: Battleground Bhabanipur: Mamata says outsiders filling up her constituency, Suvendu vows to defeat her
content: West Bengal CM says slums are being replaced by highrises full of outsiders, driving her voters away from Bhabanipur; Leader of Opposition says BJP leads in five out of eight wards in the constituency

title: Vellore Corporation issues NOC to relay VIT Road near Katpadi station
content: Corporation officials said that the stretch, which is 2.6 km long and 14 metres wide, was taken up to lay underground pipelines and construction of manholes for drainage work more than six months ago.

title: NSA Ajit Doval in Bishkek for meeting security partners of Central Asia
content: The overall security situation, especially the Afghanistan-Pakistan border conflict, is expected to be part of the discussion

title: Karnataka to upgrade 800 govt. schools to KPS at â‚¹3,000 crore
content: KPS are model government-run schools that provide education from pre-primary to II PU under one roof, with both English and Kannada medium options

title: Book on Mannarsala Sree Nagaraja Temple released
content: The 96-page book, featuring a sweeping range of photographs, explores the unique socio-religious and ecological landscape of one of the countryâ€™s most important centres of Naga worship

title: Night light data from 2013 and 2023 reveals limited urban growth in Bihar
content: Nighttime illumination is used as a proxy to gauge electricity usage and identify levels of urbanisation; very high illumination rose from 0% in 2013 to 1.6% in 2023, and was seen only in Patna

title: Sundarbans aquaculture model wins FAO global recognition
content: Nature Environment and Wildlife Societyâ€™s mangrove-linked aquaculture project lauded as a model for sustainable livelihoods

title: BJP lines up nominees for bypolls in Jharkhand, Odisha, Telangana, J&K

title: Andhra Pradesh needs SCS, not GST festivals, says APCC chief Y.S. Sharmila
content: There is no truth in the governmentâ€™s claims that GST cuts increased peopleâ€™s purchasing power, she asserts

title: Andhra Pradesh electricity employeesâ€™ talks with power utilities on October 17

title: Veteran singer Rao Balasaraswati passes away

title: Over 11,000 applications received for next Haj season

title: Record number of women officers, major career shifts shape Telanganaâ€™s latest IPS cohort
